summary: This is a court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to The Mar-a-Lago Club, commanding it to produce employment records and contact information for former HR Directors and to have a records custodian appear in court on November 29, 2021, to testify in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Damien Williams
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) for which the subpoena is issued, indicating ongoing legal proceedings against her.

connections.description: Damien Williams, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by the subpoena for her case.

events.title: Scheduled court appearance for Mar-a-Lago records custodian
events.description: The Mar-a-Lago Club is commanded to have a records custodian appear in court to testify and produce employment records in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Mar-a-Lago Club
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a subpoena to The Mar-a-Lago Club demanding employment records and a court appearance.

locations: 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 906, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenaed The Mar-a-Lago Club for employment records and contact information for former HR Directors as part of the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The subpoena requires a personal appearance by a records custodian at the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York on November 29, 2021.
Failure to comply with the subpoena would constitute contempt of court, subjecting The Mar-a-Lago Club to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The document indicates an investigative link between the Ghislaine Maxwell case and employment records at Mar-a-Lago, suggesting potential inquiries into staff or associates.
The subpoena was issued by Damien Williams, the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, on November 17, 2021.
